t: Psalm 55
Betrayal by a Friend
For the choir director: with stringed instruments. A Maskil of David.
God,*pn listen to my prayer and*ln do not hide from my plea for help.
Pay*ln attention to me and answer me. I*ln am restless and in turmoil with my complaint,
because*ln of the enemy’s words, because*ln of the pressure of the wicked. For*ln they bring down disaster on me and*ln harass me in anger.
My*pn heart shudders within me; terrors*ln of death sweep over me.
Fear*ln and trembling grip me; horror*ln has overwhelmed me.
I*ln said, “If only I had wings like a dove! I*ln would fly away and find rest.
How*ln far away I would flee; I*ln would stay in the wilderness. Selah*ig
I*ln would hurry to my shelter from*ln the raging wind and the storm.”
Lord,*pn confuse and confound their speech, for*ln I see violence and strife in the city;
day*ln and night they make the rounds on its walls. Crime*ln and trouble are within it;
destruction*ln is inside it; oppression*ln and deceit never leave its marketplace.
Now*pn it is not an enemy who insults me — otherwise*ln I could bear it; it*ln is not a foe who rises up against me — otherwise*ln I could hide from him.
But*ln it is you, a man who is my peer, my*ln companion and good friend!
We*ln used to have close fellowship; we*ln walked with the crowd into the house of God.
Let*pn death take them by surprise; let*ln them go down to Sheol alive, because*ln evil is in their homes and within them.
But*ln I call to God, and*ln the Lord*s will save me.
I*ln complain and groan morning, noon, and night, and*ln he hears my voice.
Though*ln many are against me, he*ln will redeem me from my battle unharmed.
God,*ln the one enthroned from long ago, will*ln hear and will humiliate them Selah*ig because*ln they do not change and*ln do not fear God.
My*pn friend acts violently against*ln those at peace with him; he*ln violates his covenant.
His*ln buttery words are smooth, but*ln war is in his heart. His*ln words are softer than oil, but*ln they are drawn swords.
Cast*pn your burden on the Lord,*s and*ln he will sustain you; he*ln will never allow the righteous to be shaken.
God,*pn you will bring them down to*ln the Pit of destruction; men*ln of bloodshed and treachery will*ln not live out half their days. But*ln I will trust in you.
